thread.title: Paire upsets Nishikori to advance to Japan Open final

title: Paire upsets Nishikori to advance to Japan Open final

Image 16 of 18 Benoit Paire of France receives a ball during his singles semifinal match against Kei Nishikori of Japan at the Japan Open men’s tennis tournament in Tokyo,   Eugene Hoshiko, AP Benoit Paire of France receives a ball during his singles semifinal... Image 17 of 18 Gilles Muller of Luxembourg returns a shot against Stan Wawrinka of Switzerland during their singles semifinal match at the Japan Open men’s tennis tournament in Tokyo,   Eugene Hoshiko, AP Gilles Muller of Luxembourg returns a shot against Stan Wawrinka of... Image 18 of 18 Paire upsets Nishikori to advance to Japan Open final 1  /  18 Back to Gallery TOKYO (AP) — Unseeded Benoit Paire of France beat defending champion Kei Nishikori 1-6, 6-4, 6-2 Saturday to advance to the Japan Open final where he faces top-seeded Stan Wawrinka .
After breezing through the opener when he broke Paire twice, Nishikori struggled in the second set and failed to convert any of his five break points. Paire won the set with a powerful backhand winner down the line to break the second-seeded Nishikori, who was bidding for his third Japan Open title.
Paire, who had 11 aces and saved seven of nine break points, raced ahead 4-1 in the third set and secured the win on his first match point when Nishikori hit a lob long.
Paire, who captured his first ATP title at Bastad in July, also beat Nishikori in the U.S. Open first round this year.
French Open winner Wawrinka had eight aces to beat Gilles Muller 6-4, 7-6 (5).
The Swiss reached his fourth final of the year when Muller angled his backhand volley wide in the tiebreaker.
In Sunday's final, Wawrinka will be looking to add to his wins at Chennai, Rotterdam and Roland Garros .
